1.text: When I would heal Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim is discovered, and the wickedness of Samaria: for they practise falsehood; and the thief entereth in, [and] the troop of robbers assaileth without.

2.text: And they say not in their hearts [that] I remember all their wickedness: now do their own doings encompass them; they are before my face.

3.text: They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies.

4.text: They all practise adultery, as an oven heated by the baker: he ceaseth from stirring [the fire] after he hath kneaded the dough, until it be leavened.

5.text: In the day of our king, the princes made themselves sick with the heat of wine: he stretched out his hand to scorners.

6.text: For they have applied their heart like an oven to their lying in wait: their baker sleepeth all the night; in the morning it burneth like a flaming fire.

7.text: They are all hot as an oven, and devour their judges; all their kings are fallen: there is none among them that calleth unto me.

8.text: Ephraim, he mixeth himself with the peoples; Ephraim is a cake not turned.

9.text: Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth [it] not; yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, and he knoweth [it] not.

10.text: And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face; and they do not return to Jehovah their God, nor seek him for all this.

11.text: And Ephraim is become like a silly dove without understanding: they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.

12.text: When they go, I will spread my net upon them; I will bring them down as the fowl of the heavens; I will chastise them, according as their assembly hath heard.

13.text: Woe unto them! for they have wandered from me; destruction unto them! for they have transgressed against me. And I would redeem them; but they speak lies against me.

14.text: And they cried not unto me in their heart, when they howled upon their beds; they assemble themselves for corn and new wine; they have turned aside from me.

15.text: I have indeed trained, I have strengthened their arms, but they imagine mischief against me.

16.text: They return, [but] not to the [Most] High: they are like a deceitful bow. Their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
